benchmark_details.name: RAG-RewardBench
benchmark_details.overview: RAG-RewardBench is the first benchmark for evaluating reward models in Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) settings, designed to assess alignment with human preferences through 1,485 high-quality preference pairs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a systematic evaluation framework for reward models in RAG scenarios to enhance preference alignment for retrieval augmented language models.

data.source: 18 datasets from various domains using multiple retrievers to ensure diversity.
data.annotation: Preference judgments are based on evaluations performed by LLMs as judges, reflecting human annotations.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated based on a standard evaluation framework contrasting chosen versus rejected responses.
methodology.interpretation: An accuracy score of over 50% indicates a model's ability to select better responses.
methodology.baseline_results: The best-performing model achieved 78.3% accuracy on RAG-RewardBench.
methodology.validation: Validation procedures included correlation checks between model evaluations and human annotations.
